006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.util;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonLocation;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonToken;
011
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CustomCollectors;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
014
015import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
016import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
017import org.json.JSONObject;
018import org.json.JSONTokener;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.io.InputStream;
022import java.io.Reader;
023import java.util.Arrays;
024import java.util.Collection;
025import java.util.List;
026
027import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
028import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
029
030public final class JsonUtil {
031  private static final Logger LOGGER = LogManager.getLogger(JsonUtil.class);
032
033  private JsonUtil() {
034    // disable construction
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * Parse the input stream into a JSON object.
039   *
040   * @param is
041   *          the input stream to parse
042   * @return the JSON object
043   */
044  @NonNull
045  public static JSONObject toJsonObject(@NonNull InputStream is) {
046    return new JSONObject(new JSONTokener(is));
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Parse the reader into a JSON object.
051   *
052   * @param reader
053   *          the reader to parse
054   * @return the JSON object
055   */
056  @NonNull
057  public static JSONObject toJsonObject(@NonNull Reader reader) {
058    return new JSONObject(new JSONTokener(reader));
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Generate an informational string describing the token at the current location
063   * of the provided {@code parser}.
064   *
065   * @param parser
066   *          the JSON parser
067   * @return the informational string
068   * @throws IOException
069   *           if an error occurred while getting the information from the parser
070   */
071  @SuppressWarnings("null")
072  @NonNull
073  public static String toString(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException {
074    return new StringBuilder(32)
075        .append(parser.currentToken().name())
076        .append(" '")
077        .append(parser.getText())
078        .append('\'')
079        .append(generateLocationMessage(parser))
080        .toString();
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Generate an informational string describing the provided {@code location}.
085   *
086   * @param location
087   *          a JSON parser location
088   * @return the informational string
089   */
090  @SuppressWarnings("null")
091  @NonNull
092  public static String toString(@NonNull JsonLocation location) {
093    return new StringBuilder(8)
094        .append(location.getLineNr())
095        .append(':')
096        .append(location.getColumnNr())
097        .toString();
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Advance the parser to the next location matching the provided token.
102   *
103   * @param parser
104   *          the JSON parser
105   * @param token
106   *          the expected token
107   * @return the current token or {@code null} if no tokens remain in the stream
108   * @throws IOException
109   *           if an error occurred while parsing the JSON
110   */
111  @Nullable
112  public static JsonToken advanceTo(@NonNull JsonParser parser, @NonNull JsonToken token) throws IOException {
113    JsonToken currentToken = null;
114    while (parser.hasCurrentToken() && !token.equals(currentToken = parser.currentToken())) {
115      currentToken = parser.nextToken();
116      if (LOGGER.isWarnEnabled()) {
117        LOGGER.warn("skipping over: {}{}",
118            toString(parser),
119            generateLocationMessage(parser));
120      }
121    }
122    return currentToken;
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Skip the next JSON value in the stream.
127   *
128   * @param parser
129   *          the JSON parser
130   * @return the current token or {@code null} if no tokens remain in the stream
131   * @throws IOException
132   *           if an error occurred while parsing the JSON
133   */
134  @SuppressWarnings({
135      "resource", // parser not owned
136      "PMD.CyclomaticComplexity" // acceptable
137  })
138  @Nullable
139  public static JsonToken skipNextValue(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException {
140
141    JsonToken currentToken = parser.currentToken();
142    // skip the field name
143    if (JsonToken.FIELD_NAME.equals(currentToken)) {
144      currentToken = parser.nextToken();
145    }
146
147    switch (currentToken) {
148    case START_ARRAY:
149    case START_OBJECT:
150      parser.skipChildren();
151      break;
152    case VALUE_FALSE:
153    case VALUE_NULL:
154    case VALUE_NUMBER_FLOAT:
155    case VALUE_NUMBER_INT:
156    case VALUE_STRING:
157    case VALUE_TRUE:
158      // do nothing
159      break;
160    default:
161      // error
162      String msg = String.format("Unhandled JsonToken %s%s.",
163          toString(parser),
164          generateLocationMessage(parser));
165      LOGGER.error(msg);
166      throw new UnsupportedOperationException(msg);
167    }
168
169    // advance past the value
170    return parser.nextToken();
171  }
172  //

200
201  /**
202   * Ensure that the current token is one of the provided tokens.
203   * <p>
204   * Note: This uses a Java assertion to support debugging in a whay that doesn't
205   * impact parser performance during production operation.
206   *
207   * @param parser
208   *          the JSON parser
209   * @param expectedTokens
210   *          the tokens for which one is expected to match against the current
211   *          token
212   */
213  public static void assertCurrent(
214      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
215      @NonNull JsonToken... expectedTokens) {
216    JsonToken current = parser.currentToken();
217    assert Arrays.stream(expectedTokens)
218        .anyMatch(expected -> expected.equals(current)) : generateExpectedMessage(
219            parser,
220            expectedTokens,
221            parser.currentToken());
222  }
223
224  // public static void assertCurrentIsFieldValue(@NonNull JsonParser parser) {
225  // JsonToken token = parser.currentToken();
226  // assert token.isStructStart() || token.isScalarValue() : String.format(
227  // "Expected a START_OBJECT, START_ARRAY, or VALUE_xxx token, but found
228  // JsonToken '%s'%s.",
229  // token,
230  // generateLocationMessage(parser));
231  // }
232
233  /**
234   * Ensure that the current token is the one expected and then advance the token
235   * stream.
236   *
237   * @param parser
238   *          the JSON parser
239   * @param expectedToken
240   *          the expected token
241   * @return the next token
242   * @throws IOException
243   *           if an error occurred while reading the token stream
244   */
245  @Nullable
246  public static JsonToken assertAndAdvance(
247      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
248      @NonNull JsonToken expectedToken)
249      throws IOException {
250    JsonToken token = parser.currentToken();
251    assert expectedToken.equals(token) : generateExpectedMessage(
252        parser,
253        expectedToken,
254        token);
255    return parser.nextToken();
256  }
257
258  /**
259   * Advance the token stream, then ensure that the current token is the one
260   * expected.
261   *
262   * @param parser
263   *          the JSON parser
264   * @param expectedToken
265   *          the expected token
266   * @return the next token
267   * @throws IOException
268   *           if an error occurred while reading the token stream
269   */
270  @Nullable
271  public static JsonToken advanceAndAssert(
272      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
273      @NonNull JsonToken expectedToken)
274      throws IOException {
275    JsonToken token = parser.nextToken();
276    assert expectedToken.equals(token) : generateExpectedMessage(
277        parser,
278        expectedToken,
279        token);
280    return token;
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * Generate a message intended for error reporting based on a presumed token.
285   *
286   * @param parser
287   *          the JSON parser
288   * @param expectedToken
289   *          the expected token
290   * @param actualToken
291   *          the actual token found
292   * @return the message string
293   */
294  @NonNull
295  private static String generateExpectedMessage(
296      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
297      @NonNull JsonToken expectedToken,
298      JsonToken actualToken) {
299    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
300        String.format("Expected JsonToken '%s', but found JsonToken '%s'%s.",
301            expectedToken,
302            actualToken,
303            generateLocationMessage(parser)));
304  }
305
306  /**
307   * Generate a message intended for error reporting based on a presumed set of
308   * tokens.
309   *
310   * @param parser
311   *          the JSON parser
312   * @param expectedTokens
313   *          the set of expected tokens, one of which was expected to match the
314   *          actual token
315   * @param actualToken
316   *          the actual token found
317   * @return the message string
318   */
319  @NonNull
320  private static String generateExpectedMessage(
321      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
322      @NonNull JsonToken[] expectedTokens,
323      JsonToken actualToken) {
324    List<JsonToken> expectedTokensList = ObjectUtils.notNull(Arrays.asList(expectedTokens));
325    return generateExpectedMessage(parser, expectedTokensList, actualToken);
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Generate a message intended for error reporting based on a presumed set of
330   * tokens.
331   *
332   * @param parser
333   *          the JSON parser
334   * @param expectedTokens
335   *          the set of expected tokens, one of which was expected to match the
336   *          actual token
337   * @param actualToken
338   *          the actual token found
339   * @return the message string
340   */
341  @NonNull
342  private static String generateExpectedMessage(
343      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
344      @NonNull Collection<JsonToken> expectedTokens,
345      JsonToken actualToken) {
346    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
347        String.format("Expected JsonToken(s) '%s', but found JsonToken '%s'%s.",
348            expectedTokens.stream().map(Enum::name).collect(CustomCollectors.joiningWithOxfordComma("or")),
349            actualToken,
350            generateLocationMessage(parser)));
351  }
352
353  /**
354   * Generate a location string for the current location in the JSON token stream.
355   *
356   * @param parser
357   *          the JSON parser
358   * @return the location string
359   */
360  @NonNull
361  public static CharSequence generateLocationMessage(@NonNull JsonParser parser) {
362    JsonLocation location = parser.currentLocation();
363    return location == null ? "" : generateLocationMessage(location);
364  }
365
366  /**
367   * Generate a location string for the current location in the JSON token stream.
368   *
369   * @param location
370   *          a JSON token stream location
371   * @return the location string
372   */
373  @SuppressWarnings("null")
374  @NonNull
375  public static CharSequence generateLocationMessage(@NonNull JsonLocation location) {
376    return new StringBuilder()
377        .append(" at location '")
378        .append(location.getLineNr())
379        .append(':')
380        .append(location.getColumnNr())
381        .append('\'');
382  }
383}
